H0.text: Lower pitched is the sound produced by a string on a musical instrument like a guitar when the string is made tighter.

H1.text: Higher pitched is the sound produced by a string on a musical instrument like a guitar when the string is made tighter.

H2.text: Louder is the sound produced by a guitar string when it is made tighter, so that the sound will always be louder.

H3.text: Quieter is the sound produced by a string on a musical instrument like a guitar when that string is made tighter.

A4.text: The pitch of lower tones gets lower as sound pressure increases.

A5.text: Pitch depends to a lesser degree on the sound pressure level (loudness, volume) of the tone, especially at frequencies below 1,000 Hz and above 2,000 Hz.
